## Overview {.smaller}

::: {.incremental}

- Create measure of <span style="color: purple; font-weight: bold"> data use by academia </span> for each country

- Train <span style="font-weight: bold">machine learning model </span> on <span style="text-decoration: underline">2,600  human coded </span> articles
  - 87% accuracy
  - Country rankings correlated 0.99

- Apply to corpus of 1 million academic articles
  - Database: <span style="font-weight: bold"> Semantic Scholar (s2orc) </span>
  - Language: English 
  - Time period: 2000-2020
  - Subjects: Medicine, Economics, Psychology, Sociology, Political Science

- Measures strongly correlated with: <span style="font-weight: bold">GDP per capita, population, Statistical Performance Indicator (SPI) score </span>

- High income countries produce <span style="color: blue"> 50% of all articles </span> using data
  - Low income countries produce <span style="color: orange"> 5% </span>
  
:::

## Background

-   World Bank published Statistical Performance Indicators

::: {.incremental}
-   Framework meant to be:

    -   Forward Looking

    -   Cover all areas of statistical system

    -   Includes <span style="color: purple; font-weight: bold">Data Use </span>

:::
